sub_topic: Moduli spaces of algebraic curves and their properties
message_1: Consider the moduli space $M_{2}$ of stable algebraic curves of genus 2. How many irreducible components does $M_{2}$ have?
message_2: The moduli space $M_{2}$ of stable algebraic curves of genus 2 is known to be irreducible. Therefore, it has only one irreducible component. This result is a consequence of the fact that the moduli space of stable curves of genus g is irreducible for all g â‰¥ 2.
